verses.verse: (Who Shall Abide in Godâ€™s Sanctuary?) A Psalm of David. (Ps 2.6; 24.3-5; 27.5, 6) O LORD, who may abide in your tent? Who may dwell on your holy hill?
(Ps 24.4; 51.6; Eph 4.25) Those who walk blamelessly and do what is right and speak the truth from their heart;
(Ex 23.1; Lev 19.16) who do not slander with their tongue and do no evil to their friends nor heap shame upon their neighbors;
(Judg 11.35; Acts 28.10; 2 Tim 3.8) in whose eyes the wicked are despised but who honor those who fear the LORD; who stand by their oath even to their hurt;
(Ex 22.25; 23.8; Deut 16.19; Ps 112.6) who do not lend money at interest and do not take a bribe against the innocent. Those who do these things shall never be moved.
